event_A: During the winter, temperatures were below zero on a country road that was regularly used by passing cars.
event_B: During the night, a severe storm wetted the road.
event_C: As temperatures remained below freezing, the water on the road froze and formed icy patches.
event_D: Later, a car came round a bend on this road, skidded on the icy patches, and rolled over.
outcome_negative: The car rolled over and collided with a tree, resulting in substantial damage. The driver sustained injuries from the accident and had to be taken to hospital.
outcome_positive: A dashcam video from the skidding went viral and jumpstarted the driver’s successful career as an influencer.

event_A: A clinical research team was preparing memory tests for participants in a long-term cognitive study.
event_B: A sudden gust of wind entered through an open window and knocked over the stack of test folders.
event_C: The folder order no longer matched the participant list.
event_D: During the session, two participants were handed the wrong tests.
outcome_negative: One participant received exactly the wrong test, invalidating all previously collected data for that participant.
outcome_positive: One participant received the wrong test, but in this case the mix-up did not affect the research, and the participant personally benefited from the alternative test version.

event_A: The stage lighting system had been running at full power all evening.
event_B: Heat buildup gradually accumulated in the equipment room due to unusually warm outside temperatures.
outcome_negative: The performance was interrupted mid-scene, and a panic broke out among some audience members.
outcome_positive: The sudden blackout occurred mid-scene, but the audience believed it was part of the production and reacted enthusiastically.

event_A: The escalator had been running continuously during morning rush hour.
event_B: Dust buildup from construction work outside drifted into the station overnight, settling inside the escalator housing.
event_C: The foreign object interfered with the escalator’s safety sensors.
event_D: The sensors triggered an automatic shutdown.
outcome_negative: The shutdown caused a significant bottleneck, making people late during peak hours.
outcome_positive: Maintenance inspected the escalator and detected a worn brake component, preventing a future malfunction.

event_A: The airport’s luggage-sorting system was processing a large batch of suitcases for several afternoon flights with one suitcase entering the conveyor at a time.
event_B: A brief power fluctuation in the terminal caused the barcode scanner gate to reboot incorrectly.
event_C: The misdirected suitcase was transported to a different sorting belt.
event_D: It was transported onto the wrong flight.
outcome_negative: A group of passengers arrived at their destination without their luggage, causing delays and compensation claims.
outcome_positive: During a routine weight check, staff identified the misplaced suitcase and discovered an underlying synchronization fault in the sorting system, preventing more serious disruptions later.

event_A: An old apartment building was under routine maintenance.
event_B: The pipes in the building had corrosion which led to some cracks.
event_C: Gas accumulated in a maintenance corridor.
event_D: An automatic day-night scheduler switched on the light, creating a spark.
outcome_negative: A significant explosion damaged several floors, prompting rescue operations and evacuations.
outcome_positive: A partial explosion occurred but was contained by fire-retardant materials, preventing wider structural collapse.

event_A: During a break, students set up a short Jeopardy-style trivia game. One of the categories on the board was Weather-Related Objects.
event_B: The host decided for the experimenters that this is an attention check and that you must select the event that contains the word “umbrella”.
event_C: The host read a clue that mentioned an umbrella being used during heavy rain.
event_D: The next round of the game began as players refocused on the board.
